docs.abstract: Corning Inc and Alcatel announce severe cutbacks, including plant closings, new layoffs totaling 3,500 workers and, in Corning's case, suspension of dividend payments; Corning is closing three plants, laying off 1,000 workers and eliminating dividend payments on common stock from third quarter onward; Standard & Poor's lowers Corning's corporate credit rating; Alcatel will lay off 2,500 workers (M)
docs.snippet: Corning and Alcatel, two companies that had flourished in recent years making the building blocks of the communications industry, announced severe cutbacks yesterday, including plant closings, new layoffs totaling 3,500 workers and, in the case of...

byline.original: By FELICITY BARRINGER with SIMON ROMERO

docs.lead_paragraph: Corning and Alcatel, two companies that had flourished in recent years making the building blocks of the communications industry, announced severe cutbacks yesterday, including plant closings, new layoffs totaling 3,500 workers and, in the case of Corning, the suspension of dividend payments. The actions came in response to a glut of installed fiber optic capacity and hundreds of millions of dollars of fiber optic equipment in warehouses that has not yet been sold. Corning executives said yesterday that most of its inventory would become obsolete before it could be sold.

headline.main: Corning and Alcatel Announce Large Cutbacks

docs.snippet: The software maker Computer Associates International, facing a battle with the Texas billionaire Sam Wyly for control of its board, has told investors that Mr. Wyly's plan to split the company into four units was reckless.    The company sent a le...
docs.lead_paragraph: The software maker Computer Associates International, facing a battle with the Texas billionaire Sam Wyly for control of its board, has told investors that Mr. Wyly's plan to split the company into four units was reckless. The company sent a letter, dated Saturday, to shareholders that explains the arguments for keeping Computer Associates intact, according to a filing today with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

docs.abstract: Intertrust Technologies Corp, software for protecting digital information, receives patent that it says will challenge Microsoft Corp's strategy for linking its next-generation operating system to Internet services and content like digital music; Microsoft accuses Intertrust of 'patent terrorism' (M)
docs.snippet: A small developer of software for protecting digital information received a patent yesterday that it said would challenge Microsoft's strategy for linking its next- generation operating system to Internet services and content like digital music.  ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A small developer of software for protecting digital information received a patent yesterday that it said would challenge Microsoft's strategy for linking its next- generation operating system to Internet services and content like digital music. Microsoft accused the small company of ''patent terrorism.''

headline.main: Patent Adds Twist to Software Lawsuit

docs.abstract: Boston Scientific Corporation files lawsuit in Israel against Kobi and Judith Richter, principal owners of Medinol Ltd, Israeli medical device maker; suit asks court to order Boston Scientific and Richters to agree to procedure under which each side submits offer to buy shares held by other party; party that proposes higher company value would buy other's shares in Medinol; procedure, known as 'buy me-buy you,' is set out under Israeli law when shareholders cannot resolve differences; Boston Scientific owns about 20 percent of Medinol (M)
docs.snippet: The Boston Scientific Corporation filed a lawsuit today in Israel against the principal owners of Medinol Ltd., an Israeli medical device maker, in the latest salvo in a dispute between the companies.    The lawsuit asks the court to order Boston ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Boston Scientific Corporation filed a lawsuit today in Israel against the principal owners of Medinol Ltd., an Israeli medical device maker, in the latest salvo in a dispute between the companies. The lawsuit asks the court to order Boston Scientific and the principal owners of Medinol, Kobi and Judith Richter, to agree to a procedure under which each side submits an offer to buy the shares held by the other party. The party that proposes the higher company value would buy the other's shares in Medinol.

docs.abstract: SBC Communications Inc withdraws FCC application to offer long-distance service in Missiouri amid questions about prices and support systems; will refile application after providing updated data and responding to concerns raised by antitrust officials and rivals (S)
docs.snippet: SBC Communications Inc., the nation's second-largest local telephone carrier, withdrew its application today to offer long-distance service in Missouri amid questions about prices and its support systems.    While the withdrawal is a setback for S...
docs.lead_paragraph: SBC Communications Inc., the nation's second-largest local telephone carrier, withdrew its application today to offer long-distance service in Missouri amid questions about prices and its support systems. While the withdrawal is a setback for SBC, the company said that it plans to refile its application after providing updated data and responding to the concerns raised by antitrust officials and its rivals.

headline.main: A Setback for SBC's Long-Distance Plans

docs.abstract: UAL Corp will buy MyPoints.com, online marketer that gathers data about consumers and uses it to sell them products and services, in deal valued at $105 million (M)
docs.snippet: Jumping into one of the most troubled sectors of the Internet economy, the parent of United Airlines said yesterday that it would buy MyPoints.com, an online marketing company, in a deal valued at $105 million.    MyPoints runs a variety of progra...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jumping into one of the most troubled sectors of the Internet economy, the parent of United Airlines said yesterday that it would buy MyPoints.com, an online marketing company, in a deal valued at $105 million. MyPoints runs a variety of programs that gather information about consumers, both online and off, and uses it to sell products and services to them. But it has been shrinking rapidly as the Internet advertising market has hit hard times. Its revenue in the first quarter was $10 million, down from a peak of $18.7 million in the second quarter of 2000.

docs.abstract: Microsoft Corp plans to introduce new version of its Office program that is most Internet-connected product yet from company; Office XP, which will sell for $499 and be available in 15 countries, is sixth version of program, which was first introduced in 1991 (M)
docs.snippet: Discounting an imminent federal court ruling that could limit the company's march toward dominating the commercial Internet, Microsoft plans to introduce on Thursday a new version of its Office program that is the most Internet-connected product y...
docs.lead_paragraph: Discounting an imminent federal court ruling that could limit the company's march toward dominating the commercial Internet, Microsoft plans to introduce on Thursday a new version of its Office program that is the most Internet-connected product yet from the company. Office XP, which will sell for $499 and be available in 15 countries, is the sixth version of the program, which was first introduced in 1991.

headline.main: Microsoft to Introduce New Version of Office

docs.abstract: Vesper, Brazilian provider of fixed wireless telephone service, will put less emphasis on expanding among low-income consumers, which now make up about 75 percent of its clients, and focus on wealthier households or businesses; each household in fixed wireless network, also known as wireless local loop, has wireless transmitter-receiver that communications with wireless network antenna; Vesper's retrenchment suggests that fixed wireless will not be in itself the answer to creating universal phone service in countries with large low-income populations; photo (M)
docs.snippet: It seemed like the perfect marriage of a new technology and an underserved market. Last year, a company called Vésper started advertising a type of wireless residential telephone service that could be installed much faster than could traditional ...
docs.lead_paragraph: It seemed like the perfect marriage of a new technology and an underserved market. Last year, a company called Vésper started advertising a type of wireless residential telephone service that could be installed much faster than could traditional phone lines and would be cheaper to use than mobile cellular phones would be. People like Rosa Marta, a 31-year-old housekeeper, jumped at the chance. ''I had a phone in my house in three days,'' said Ms. Marta, recalling the installation, which was made last September. She had been waiting years for a conventional phone from the local telephone company. ''I sold my cellular phone, and now I spend only about 70 reais [about $30] on my phone bill,'' she said, noting that her cell phone bill had been about 200 reais, or $85, a month. ''I think it's wonderful.''

headline.main: In Brazil, Phone Service for All?

docs.abstract: CERT Coordination Center, clearinghouse for news on new computer viruses operated by Carnegie Mellon University, has been bombarded by vandals for two days and center did not hold; Web site was knocked out by distributed denial of service attack, in which malicious hackers take over computers on Internet and cause them to flood target site with spurious demands for data and other small tasks (M)
docs.snippet: The CERT Coordination Center is one of the premier places that the online world turns to for information when computer vandals attack; the federally financed research center, operated by Carnegie Mellon University, has long served as a clearinghou...
docs.lead_paragraph: The CERT Coordination Center is one of the premier places that the online world turns to for information when computer vandals attack; the federally financed research center, operated by Carnegie Mellon University, has long served as a clearinghouse for news on new viruses, worms and other virtual nastiness. But yesterday and Tuesday it was CERT that was being bombarded, and the center did not hold. Its Web site was knocked out by a distributed denial of service attack, in which malicious hackers take over computers on the Internet and cause them to flood a target site with spurious demands for data and other small tasks. A denial of service does not involve a break-in at the target site; it just keeps the victim's machine so busy responding to the stream of automated requests that legitimate visitors cannot get in.

headline.main: Computer Vandals Clog Antivandalism Web Site

docs.abstract: Vivendi Universal's decision to acquire Mp3.com highlights trend in music industry in which number of leading music startups have been absored, in whole or in part, by very recording labels they set out to challenge; Mp3.com founder Michael Robertson says acquisition makes sense because it will give Mp3.com resources to develop its own initiatives, while giving Vivendi Universal technology to sell its own music over Internet (M)
docs.snippet: Internet start-ups like MP3.com, Napster and EMusic.com set out several years ago to challenge major record labels as the predominant distributors of music. But the announcement on Sunday that Vivendi Universal is buying MP3.com punctuates how rad...
docs.lead_paragraph: Internet start-ups like MP3.com, Napster and EMusic.com set out several years ago to challenge major record labels as the predominant distributors of music. But the announcement on Sunday that Vivendi Universal is buying MP3.com punctuates how radically things have changed: in recent months, a number of the leading music upstarts have been absorbed, in whole or in part, by the very labels they set out to challenge. The upshot, industry analysts say, is that the five major record companies could wind up actually consolidating their power in an Internet age that some analysts thought would shake the labels to their core.

headline.main: Online Upstarts of Music Join Major Record Labels
